Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Children in these neighborhoods primarily ingest lead from dust in their homes and yards.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: residing in areas with high concentration of pre-1980 homes, as shown on the map

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Kids raised in Memphis’ suburbs face little risk of lead poisoning since few homes there were built after 1978.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: living in areas with low concentration of pre-1978 homes, due to suburban development patterns

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Children in Cordova are far safer from lead poisoning than kids in Midtown. And children in Arlington are much better off than their counterparts in North Memphis.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: comparing lead poisoning risks across different Memphis neighborhoods with varying home ages

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: about 96% of residents are Black, and about 91% of homes were built prior to 1978, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.
Document Sources.Source Justification: authoritative source for demographic and housing data

Named Person Sources.Source Justification: credentialed journalist covering housing and development for MLK50: Justice Through Journalism
